meaning: to reduce in amount, degree, or severity
sentence: The storm suddenly abated, leaving behind a calm sea.

meaning: a departure from what is normal or expected
sentence: The outbreak of violence in this peaceful neighborhood was an aberration.

meaning: to renounce or retract, especially with formal solemnity
sentence: He decided to abjure his previous beliefs after extensive research.

meaning: exist in large numbers or amounts
sentence: Wildlife abounds in the national park.

meaning: to hold oneself back voluntarily, especially from something regarded as improper or unhealthy
sentence: He abstained from eating meat during the month of fasting.

meaning: able to be reached or entered
sentence: The remote village is only accessible by helicopter.

meaning: excessively interested in acquiring money or material things
sentence: Her acquisitive nature led her to pursue a career in finance.

meaning: the ability to make good judgments and quick decisions, typically in a particular domain
sentence: Her business acumen is well respected in the industry.

meaning: to caution, advise, or counsel against something
sentence: The teacher admonished the students for talking during the lesson.

meaning: to make something impure by adding inferior materials
sentence: The company was fined for trying to adulterate its products with cheaper substances.

meaning: one's opponent in a contest, conflict, or dispute
sentence: He managed to defeat his adversary in the final match.

meaning: to speak in favor of; support or urge by argument
sentence: She is known to advocate for the rights of the underprivileged.

meaning: concerned with beauty or the appreciation of beauty
sentence: The aesthetic design of the building won several awards.

meaning: behavior, speech, or writing that is artificial and designed to impress
sentence: His accent seemed to be an affectation rather than a natural trait.

meaning: to increase the power, status, or wealth of
sentence: He sought to aggrandize his reputation by spreading false stories about his achievements.

meaning: brisk and cheerful readiness
sentence: She accepted the invitation with alacrity.

meaning: not friendly or forthcoming; cool and distant
sentence: He remained aloof from the rest of the group during the meeting.

meaning: to combine or unite to form one organization or structure
sentence: The two companies decided to amalgamate to increase their market share.

meaning: to make (something bad or unsatisfactory) better
sentence: Steps were taken to ameliorate the poor working conditions.

meaning: open and responsive to suggestion; easily persuaded or controlled
sentence: She was amenable to the idea of extending the deadline.

meaning: belonging to a period other than that being portrayed
sentence: The use of a typewriter in the office was seen as anachronistic in the digital age.

meaning: understood by few; mysterious or secret
sentence: The professor's lectures were full of arcane references that confused most of the students.

meaning: very old or old-fashioned
sentence: The archaic laws were finally abolished after decades of debate.

meaning: involving or requiring strenuous effort; difficult and tiring
sentence: Climbing the mountain was an arduous task that took days to complete.

meaning: without guile or deception
sentence: Her artless charm won the hearts of everyone she met.

meaning: to find out for certain
sentence: The detective was able to ascertain the truth after thorough investigation.

meaning: characterized by or suggesting the practice of severe self-discipline and abstention from all forms of indulgence, typically for religious reasons
sentence: The monk lived an ascetic life of fasting and prayer.

meaning: harshness of tone or manner
sentence: The asperity in his voice made it clear that he was upset.

meaning: having or showing a confident and forceful personality
sentence: She was assertive in expressing her opinions during the meeting.

meaning: to make (an unpleasant feeling) less intense
sentence: The medicine helped to assuage her pain.

meaning: great surprise
sentence: To her astonishment, she found herself promoted after only a few months.

meaning: to reduce the force, effect, or value of
sentence: The effects of the disease were attenuated by early treatment.

meaning: showing a willingness to take surprisingly bold risks
sentence: Her audacious plan to climb the highest peak without any assistance amazed everyone.

meaning: to make something greater by adding to it; increase
sentence: He worked extra hours to augment his income.

meaning: severe or strict in manner, attitude, or appearance
sentence: The teacher was known for his austere demeanor.

meaning: having or showing an extreme greed for wealth or material gain
sentence: The avaricious businessman was known for exploiting his workers.

meaning: having a strong dislike of or opposition to something
sentence: She was averse to the idea of working overtime.

meaning: a strong dislike or disinclination
sentence: He had a deep aversion to speaking in public.

meaning: so lacking in originality as to be obvious and boring
sentence: The movie was criticized for its banal plot.

meaning: to send (someone) away from a country or place as an official punishment
sentence: The king decided to banish the traitor from the kingdom.

meaning: the lowest part or edge of something, especially the part on which it rests or is supported
sentence: The base of the statue was made of marble.

meaning: (of an appearance) fail to give a true notion or impression of (something); disguise or contradict
sentence: His calm demeanor belied the anger he felt inside.

meaning: gentle; kindly
sentence: The old man had a benign smile that put everyone at ease.

meaning: to expose (one's country, a group, or a person) to danger by treacherously giving information to an enemy
sentence: She felt betrayed when her friend revealed her secret.

meaning: showing a casual and cheerful indifference considered to be callous or improper
sentence: She showed a blithe disregard for the rules.

meaning: not genuine or true; fake
sentence: The police caught the man who was using a bogus identity.

meaning: rough and bad-mannered; coarse
sentence: His boorish behavior embarrassed everyone at the dinner party.

meaning: to support or strengthen; prop up
sentence: The government is planning to bolster the economy with new policies.

meaning: bold and without shame
sentence: She made a brazen attempt to steal the spotlight during the event.

meaning: to bring (something) under control; curb
sentence: He struggled to bridle his anger during the heated argument.

meaning: to tolerate or allow (something, typically dissent or opposition)
sentence: The dictator would brook no opposition to his rule.

meaning: relating to the pleasant aspects of the countryside and country life
sentence: They enjoyed the bucolic charm of the village.

meaning: the making of false and defamatory statements about someone in order to damage their reputation; slander
sentence: She was the victim of calumny after her political opponent spread lies about her.

meaning: truthful and straightforward; frank
sentence: He was candid about the mistakes he had made.

meaning: to regard as being above reproach or of great significance
sentence: The author was canonized by critics for his contributions to literature.

meaning: given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behavior
sentence: The weather in the mountains can be capricious.

meaning: to reprimand (someone) severely
sentence: The manager castigated the employee for his repeated mistakes.

meaning: relating to or denoting a violent natural event
sentence: The earthquake was a cataclysmic event that changed the landscape forever.

meaning: to express severe disapproval of (someone or something), typically in a formal statement
sentence: The senator was censured for breaking the code of conduct.

meaning: showing or relating to excessive or prejudiced loyalty or support for a particular group or cause
sentence: His chauvinistic views about gender roles alienated many of his colleagues.

meaning: to protect and care for someone lovingly
sentence: She cherished the memories of her childhood.

meaning: the use of trickery to achieve a political, financial, or legal purpose
sentence: The company was accused of using chicanery to avoid paying taxes.

meaning: to restrict (something) within limits
sentence: The new laws were intended to circumscribe the powers of the president.

meaning: wary and unwilling to take risks
sentence: She was circumspect in her decision to invest in the new venture.

meaning: making a loud and confused noise
sentence: The clamorous crowd gathered outside the stadium.

meaning: a loud, resonant sound
sentence: The clangor of the bells could be heard throughout the village.

meaning: to hide or disguise (something)
sentence: He cloaked his true intentions behind a friendly smile.

meaning: the action or fact of complying with a wish or command
sentence: The factory was shut down due to non-compliance with safety regulations.

meaning: to act in accordance with a wish or command
sentence: She agreed to comply with the court's ruling.

meaning: a feeling of guilt or moral scruple that prevents or follows the doing of something bad
sentence: He felt no compunction about cheating on the exam.

meaning: naturally accompanying or associated
sentence: The drug's use carries a risk of concomitant side effects.

meaning: to accept and allow (behavior that is considered morally wrong or offensive) to continue
sentence: The teacher could not condone such rude behavior in the classroom.

meaning: making a certain situation or outcome likely or possible
sentence: A quiet room is conducive to studying.

meaning: to grant or bestow (a title, degree, benefit, or right)
sentence: The university will confer honorary degrees at the ceremony.

meaning: to cause surprise or confusion in (someone), especially by acting against their expectations
sentence: The magician's tricks confounded the audience.

meaning: based on or involving conjecture; speculative
sentence: His conclusions were highly conjectural, lacking solid evidence.

meaning: general agreement
sentence: There was a consensus among the board members to approve the new policy.

meaning: standing out so as to be clearly visible
sentence: The bright yellow car was conspicuous in the parking lot.

meaning: to interpret (a word or action) in a particular way
sentence: His silence could be construed as agreement.

meaning: causing or likely to cause an argument; controversial
sentence: The new policy has been the subject of much contentious debate.

meaning: to struggle to surmount (a difficulty or danger)
sentence: She had to contend with many obstacles to achieve her goals.

meaning: subject to chance
sentence: The success of the project is contingent on the approval of the budget.

meaning: feeling or expressing remorse or penitence; affected by guilt
sentence: She was contrite after realizing the harm her words had caused.

meaning: a confusing and difficult problem or question
sentence: The math problem presented a challenging conundrum for the students.

meaning: based on or in accordance with what is generally done or believed
sentence: He chose to take a conventional approach to the problem.

meaning: to come together from different directions so as eventually to meet
sentence: The two rivers converge at the base of the mountain.

meaning: friendly, lively, and enjoyable
sentence: The atmosphere at the party was convivial and relaxed.

meaning: abundant in supply or quantity
sentence: She took copious notes during the lecture.

meaning: to confirm or give support to (a statement, theory, or finding)
sentence: The witness's testimony corroborated the defendant's alibi.

meaning: familiar with and at ease in many different countries and cultures
sentence: She had a cosmopolitan upbringing, having lived in several countries.

meaning: to yearn to possess or have (something)
sentence: He coveted his neighbor's new car.

meaning: not openly acknowledged or displayed
sentence: The spy's mission was to gather covert intelligence.

meaning: contemptibly lacking in courage; cowardly
sentence: His craven refusal to confront the problem only made matters worse.

meaning: sad and disappointed
sentence: She was crestfallen when she didn't get the job.

meaning: to reach a climax or point of highest development
sentence: The year-long project culminated in a successful presentation.

meaning: having or showing skill in achieving one's ends by deceit or evasion
sentence: The fox is often depicted as a cunning animal in folklore.

meaning: to reduce in extent or quantity; impose a restriction on
sentence: The company decided to curtail its spending due to budget cuts.

meaning: believing that people are motivated by self-interest; distrustful of human sincerity or integrity
sentence: He was cynical about the politician's promises.

meaning: seeming difficult to deal with in anticipation; intimidating
sentence: The task of cleaning the entire house seemed daunting at first.

meaning: to waste time; be slow
sentence: Stop dawdling and finish your homework!

meaning: a scarcity or lack of something
sentence: There was a dearth of fresh water during the drought.

meaning: to expose the falseness or hollowness of (a myth, idea, or belief)
sentence: The scientist worked to debunk the myths surrounding the new technology.

meaning: characterized by or reflecting a state of moral or cultural decline
sentence: The once-great empire fell into a decadent decline.

meaning: behavior in keeping with good taste and propriety
sentence: The children were taught to behave with decorum at formal events.

meaning: to be a sign of; indicate
sentence: The red flag denoted a warning of danger ahead.

meaning: to express contempt for; ridicule
sentence: He was derided by his peers for his unusual ideas.

meaning: a lack of compatibility or similarity between two or more facts
sentence: There was a discrepancy between the two reports that needed to be resolved.

meaning: individually separate and distinct
sentence: The data was divided into discrete categories for analysis.

meaning: available for use at the discretion of the user
sentence: The manager has discretionary power to approve or deny the request.

meaning: not candid or sincere, typically by pretending that one knows less about something than one really does
sentence: Her apology seemed disingenuous, as if she didn't really mean it.

meaning: not influenced by considerations of personal advantage
sentence: The judge was known for his disinterested and fair decisions.

meaning: lacking a coherent sequence or connection
sentence: The disjointed speech was difficult for the audience to follow.

meaning: to order or allow to leave; send away
sentence: The teacher dismissed the class early.

meaning: to regard or represent as being of little worth
sentence: He never missed an opportunity to disparage his competitors.

meaning: essentially different in kind; not allowing comparison
sentence: The two cultures were so disparate that communication was difficult.

meaning: to extract the essential meaning or most important aspects of
sentence: The professor was able to distill the complex theory into a simple explanation.

meaning: recognizably different in nature from something else of a similar type
sentence: The twins have distinct personalities despite their identical appearance.

meaning: to pull or twist out of shape
sentence: The funhouse mirrors distorted their reflections.

meaning: tending to be different or develop in different directions
sentence: The two species have evolved along divergent paths.

meaning: to deprive (someone) of power, rights, or possessions
sentence: The new regulations will divest the company of its monopoly.

meaning: to make known (private or sensitive information)
sentence: She refused to divulge the details of their conversation.

meaning: having or showing tenacity and grim persistence
sentence: His dogged determination helped him overcome the challenges.

meaning: inclined to lay down principles as incontrovertibly true
sentence: The professor's dogmatic approach to teaching left little room for discussion.

meaning: (of an animal) having normal physical functions suspended or slowed down for a period of time; in or as if in a deep sleep
sentence: The volcano has been dormant for centuries.

meaning: hesitating or doubting
sentence: She was dubious about the effectiveness of the new drug.

meaning: to deceive; trick
sentence: The scam artist duped him into giving away his savings.

meaning: deceitful
sentence: Her duplicitous nature made it difficult to trust her.

meaning: resulting from or showing sincere and intense conviction
sentence: He was earnest in his efforts to help the community.

meaning: cheerful and full of energy
sentence: The ebullient crowd cheered as the band took the stage.

meaning: (of a person or their behavior) unconventional and slightly strange
sentence: The artist was known for his eccentric style.

meaning: deriving ideas, style, or taste from a broad and diverse range of sources
sentence: Her music taste is eclectic, ranging from classical to modern rock.

meaning: to instruct or improve (someone) morally or intellectually
sentence: The book was intended to edify its readers on the importance of kindness.

meaning: (of something inanimate or abstract) successful in producing a desired or intended result; effective
sentence: The treatment was efficacious in reducing the symptoms of the disease.

meaning: outstandingly bad; shocking
sentence: His egregious mistake cost the company millions of dollars.

meaning: make (someone) ecstatically happy
sentence: She was elated to hear that she had won the competition.

meaning: to evoke or draw out (a reaction, answer, or fact) from someone
sentence: The teacher's question was designed to elicit thoughtful responses.

meaning: to make (something) clear; explain
sentence: The guide used diagrams to elucidate the complex process.

meaning: difficult to find, catch, or achieve
sentence: Success proved elusive for the young entrepreneur.

meaning: to make (something) more attractive by the addition of decorative details or features
sentence: She embellished her story with vivid details.

meaning: based on, concerned with, or verifiable by observation or experience rather than theory or pure logic
sentence: The scientist's conclusions were based on empirical evidence.

meaning: to match or surpass (a person or achievement), typically by imitation
sentence: She hoped to emulate her mother's success as a doctor.

meaning: to fill (someone) with great delight; charm
sentence: The beautiful scenery enchanted the travelers.

meaning: a speech or piece of writing that praises someone or something highly
sentence: The CEO received an encomium for his contributions to the industry.

meaning: to intrude on (a person's territory or a thing considered to be a right)
sentence: The new construction plans encroach on the protected wildlife area.

meaning: (of a disease or condition) regularly found among particular people or in a certain area
sentence: Malaria is endemic in many tropical regions.

meaning: to cause (someone) to feel drained of energy or vitality; weaken
sentence: The long hike through the mountains enervated the group.

meaning: to cause or give rise to (a feeling, situation, or condition)
sentence: The policy change is likely to engender controversy.

meaning: a person or thing that is mysterious, puzzling, or difficult to understand
sentence: Her sudden disappearance remains an enigma.

meaning: difficult to interpret or understand; mysterious
sentence: The artist's enigmatic smile has puzzled viewers for centuries.

meaning: the state or feeling of being actively opposed or hostile to someone or something
sentence: There was a long-standing enmity between the two families.

meaning: to establish (an attitude, habit, or belief) so firmly that change is very difficult or unlikely
sentence: The company's position in the market is firmly entrenched.

meaning: lasting for a very short time
sentence: The beauty of the sunset was ephemeral, fading within minutes.

meaning: mental calmness, composure, and evenness of temper, especially in a difficult situation
sentence: She maintained her equanimity even in the face of criticism.

meaning: fair and impartial
sentence: The judge's ruling was seen as equitable by both parties.

meaning: open to more than one interpretation; ambiguous
sentence: Her answer was equivocal, leaving us unsure of her true feelings.

meaning: to use ambiguous language so as to conceal the truth or avoid committing oneself
sentence: The politician was known to equivocate when faced with difficult questions.

meaning: to destroy completely; put an end to
sentence: The government launched a campaign to eradicate poverty.

meaning: not even or regular in pattern or movement; unpredictable
sentence: His erratic driving caused concern among other motorists.

meaning: having or showing great knowledge or learning
sentence: The professor was an erudite scholar in his field.

meaning: to deliberately avoid using; abstain from
sentence: He decided to eschew social media to focus on his studies.

meaning: intended for or likely to be understood by only a small number of people with a specialized knowledge or interest
sentence: The book is filled with esoteric knowledge that only experts will understand.

meaning: to adopt or support (a cause, belief, or way of life)
sentence: She espoused the values of honesty and integrity.

meaning: no longer close or affectionate to someone; alienated
sentence: He became estranged from his family after the argument.

meaning: extremely delicate and light in a way that seems too perfect for this world
sentence: The dancer's movements were graceful and ethereal.

meaning: a speech or piece of writing that praises someone or something highly, typically someone who has just died
sentence: The eulogy was a beautiful tribute to her life.

meaning: a mild or indirect word or expression substituted for one considered to be too harsh or blunt when referring to something unpleasant or embarrassing
sentence: He used a euphemism to avoid mentioning the harsh reality of the situation.

meaning: a feeling or state of intense excitement and happiness
sentence: Winning the championship brought a sense of euphoria to the team.

meaning: to escape or avoid, especially by cleverness or trickery
sentence: He managed to evade capture by hiding in the forest.

meaning: soon passing out of sight, memory, or existence; quickly fading or disappearing
sentence: The rainbow was evanescent, vanishing as quickly as it appeared.

meaning: tending to avoid commitment or self-revelation, especially by responding only indirectly
sentence: Her evasive answers made us suspect she was hiding something.

meaning: to make (a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling) worse
sentence: The new law could exacerbate the problem of poverty.

meaning: making great demands on one's skill, attention, or other resources
sentence: The job was exacting, requiring a high level of precision and dedication.

meaning: to hold (someone or something) in very high regard; think or speak very highly of
sentence: The mayor exalted the firefighters for their bravery.

meaning: to show or declare that (someone) is not guilty of wrongdoing
sentence: The evidence served to exculpate the accused.

meaning: a person or thing serving as a typical example or excellent model
sentence: She is an exemplar of hard work and dedication.

meaning: pressing; demanding
sentence: The exigent demands of the job required her full attention.

meaning: to absolve (someone) from blame for a fault or wrongdoing, especially after due consideration of the case
sentence: The DNA evidence exonerated the man who had been wrongly accused.

meaning: originating in or characteristic of a distant foreign country
sentence: She admired the exotic plants in the botanical garden.

meaning: (of an action) convenient and practical although possibly improper or immoral
sentence: He chose the most expedient method of getting the job done, even though it wasn't the most ethical.

meaning: stated clearly and in detail, leaving no room for confusion or doubt
sentence: The instructions were explicit, so everyone knew what was expected.

meaning: making use of a situation or treating others unfairly in order to gain an advantage or benefit
sentence: The company was accused of exploitative labor practices.

meaning: very attentive to and concerned about accuracy and detail
sentence: The artist was fastidious in his attention to detail.

meaning: to understand (a difficult problem or an enigmatic person) after much thought
sentence: She couldn't fathom why he would make such a decision.

meaning: lacking initiative or strength of character; irresponsible
sentence: His feckless behavior at work eventually led to his dismissal.

meaning: producing or capable of producing an abundance of offspring or new growth; fertile
sentence: The fecund soil of the region is ideal for farming.

meaning: lacking physical strength, especially as a result of age or illness
sentence: After the illness, he felt too feeble to get out of bed.

meaning: intensely enthusiastic or passionate, especially to an excessive degree
sentence: The politician gave a fervid speech that energized the crowd.

meaning: (of a wound or sore) become septic; suppurate
sentence: If you don't treat the cut properly, it could fester.

meaning: changing frequently, especially as regards one's loyalties or affections
sentence: The public is fickle, and tastes in fashion can change overnight.

meaning: tending to attract attention because of their exuberance, confidence, and stylishness
sentence: He was known for his flamboyant dress sense and bold personality.

meaning: having a red or flushed complexion; elaborately or excessively intricate or complicated
sentence: His florid writing style was not to everyone's taste.

meaning: to openly disregard (a rule, law, or convention)
sentence: He continued to flout the rules despite repeated warnings.

meaning: recklessly bold or rash
sentence: It was foolhardy of him to drive so fast in such bad weather.

meaning: able to be foreseen or predicted
sentence: There are no foreseeable problems with the new system.

meaning: to prevent or obstruct (an anticipated event or action) by taking action ahead of time
sentence: They worked to forestall the spread of the disease.

meaning: to abandon (someone or something)
sentence: He decided to forsake his career to focus on his family.

meaning: happening by a lucky chance; fortunate
sentence: The timing of their meeting was entirely fortuitous.

meaning: to encourage or promote the development of (something, typically something regarded as good)
sentence: The school aims to foster a sense of community among its students.

meaning: (typically of children) irritable and quarrelsome
sentence: The fractious child was difficult to calm down.

meaning: not having any serious purpose or value
sentence: She was criticized for spending money on frivolous items.

meaning: to deny or contradict (a fact or statement)
sentence: It's hard to gainsay the benefits of a good education.

meaning: to shock or excite (someone) into taking action
sentence: The threat of layoffs galvanized the employees to work harder.

meaning: obtrusively bright and showy; lurid
sentence: The room was decorated in garish colors that clashed horribly.

meaning: excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters
sentence: The garrulous old man told stories that lasted for hours.

meaning: nervously awkward and ungainly
sentence: As a teenager, he was tall and gawky, with big hands and feet.

meaning: (of words or the person speaking them) fluent and voluble but insincere and shallow
sentence: His glib remarks about the crisis only made the situation worse.

meaning: looking or feeling dejected; morose
sentence: He felt glum after his team lost the championship.

meaning: to give (someone) pleasure or satisfaction
sentence: The praise he received gratified him greatly.

meaning: (of a person) fond of company; sociable
sentence: She was a gregarious person who loved hosting parties.

meaning: sly or cunning intelligence
sentence: The spy used his guile to infiltrate the enemy camp.

meaning: (of a phrase or idea) lacking significance through having been overused; unoriginal and trite
sentence: The hackneyed expressions in the movie's dialogue bored the audience.

meaning: a lengthy and aggressive speech
sentence: The politician's harangue against corruption lasted for nearly an hour.

meaning: a person or thing that announces or signals the approach of another
sentence: The crocus is a harbinger of spring.

meaning: lacking any obvious principle of organization
sentence: The books were arranged in a haphazard manner on the shelf.

meaning: the pursuit of pleasure; sensual self-indulgence
sentence: The novel's protagonist lives a life of hedonism, seeking pleasure in all things.

meaning: to pay attention to; take notice of
sentence: They failed to heed the warning and suffered the consequences.

meaning: diverse in character or content
sentence: The population of the city is very heterogeneous, with people from many different cultures.

meaning: a pause or gap in a sequence, series, or process
sentence: The band is on hiatus while the lead singer recovers from surgery.

meaning: to create difficulties for (someone or something), resulting in delay or obstruction
sentence: His injury will hinder his ability to play in the game.

meaning: of the same kind; alike
sentence: The village has a fairly homogeneous population.

meaning: lacking excitement or variety; dull; monotonous
sentence: She grew tired of the humdrum routine of her job.

meaning: unable to be placated
sentence: Despite his apologies, she remained implacable.

meaning: implied though not plainly expressed
sentence: There was an implicit agreement between the two parties.

meaning: to beg someone earnestly or desperately to do something
sentence: She implored him to stay and not leave her alone.

meaning: to create and perform (music, drama, or verse) spontaneously or without preparation
sentence: The actor had to improvise when he forgot his lines.

meaning: (of something regarded as unpleasant) continuing without pause or interruption
sentence: The incessant noise from the construction site was unbearable.

meaning: in an initial stage; beginning to happen or develop
sentence: The project is still in its incipient stages.

meaning: not in harmony or keeping with the surroundings or other aspects of something
sentence: The bright modern decor was incongruous with the old-fashioned architecture of the building.

meaning: (of a person or their manner) unwilling or unable to believe something
sentence: She was incredulous when she heard the news.

meaning: necessary for (someone) as a duty or responsibility
sentence: It is incumbent upon all citizens to vote in the election.

meaning: (of a person or their efforts) persisting tirelessly
sentence: Her indefatigable spirit kept her going despite the challenges.

meaning: wanting to avoid activity or exertion; lazy
sentence: His indolent nature prevented him from achieving much in life.

meaning: diligent and hard-working
sentence: She is an industrious student who always completes her assignments on time.

meaning: lacking the ability or strength to move
sentence: The inert body of the animal was found by the roadside.

meaning: impossible to stop or prevent
sentence: The inexorable advance of technology has changed the world.

meaning: incapable of making mistakes or being wrong
sentence: No one is infallible, and everyone makes mistakes sometimes.

meaning: well known for some bad quality or deed
sentence: The city is infamous for its high crime rate.

meaning: to deduce or conclude (information) from evidence and reasoning rather than from explicit statements
sentence: From the data, we can infer that the company's profits will continue to decline.

meaning: (of a person) clever, original, and inventive
sentence: The engineer came up with an ingenious solution to the problem.

meaning: (of a person or action) innocent and unsuspecting
sentence: Her ingenuous nature made her an easy target for scammers.

meaning: to hinder, restrain, or prevent (an action or process)
sentence: The fear of failure can inhibit people from trying new things.

meaning: tending to obstruct or harm
sentence: His actions were inimical to the interests of the company.

meaning: not harmful or offensive
sentence: The comment was meant to be innocuous, but it upset her nonetheless.

meaning: impossible to understand or interpret
sentence: His inscrutable expression made it hard to know what he was thinking.

meaning: lacking flavor; lacking vigor or interest
sentence: The soup was insipid and needed more seasoning.

meaning: ignorant of or uninterested in cultures, ideas, or peoples outside one's own experience
sentence: His insular views made it difficult for him to relate to others.

meaning: able to be understood; comprehensible
sentence: The instructions were barely intelligible due to the poor translation.

meaning: endless (often used hyperbolically)
sentence: The meeting seemed interminable, lasting well into the evening.

meaning: unwilling or refusing to change one's views or to agree about something
sentence: The negotiations stalled due to the intransigent stance of both parties.

meaning: fearless; adventurous (often used for rhetorical or humorous effect)
sentence: The intrepid explorers ventured deep into the uncharted jungle.

meaning: belonging naturally; essential
sentence: The intrinsic value of the diamond made it highly sought after.

meaning: to overwhelm (someone) with things or people to be dealt with
sentence: She was inundated with emails after her promotion was announced.

meaning: to accustom (someone) to something, especially something unpleasant
sentence: The soldiers were inured to the harsh conditions of the battlefield.

meaning: having a particular habit, activity, or interest that is long-established and unlikely to change
sentence: He was an inveterate gambler, despite the many losses he had suffered.

meaning: (of an action or situation) likely to arouse or incur resentment or anger in others
sentence: The manager's invidious comparisons between employees caused tension in the office.

meaning: never to be broken, infringed, or dishonored
sentence: The treaty was considered inviolable by both sides.

meaning: having or showing a tendency to be easily angered
sentence: The irascible old man was known for his quick temper.

meaning: irritating; annoying
sentence: The constant noise from the construction site was irksome.

meaning: showing a lack of respect for people or things that are generally taken seriously
sentence: The comedian's irreverent jokes offended some members of the audience.

meaning: to throw or drop (something) from an aircraft or ship
sentence: The crew had to jettison some of the cargo to lighten the load.

meaning: having, showing, or done with good judgment or sense
sentence: Her judicious use of resources helped the company avoid bankruptcy.

meaning: (of a person, speech, or style of writing) using very few words
sentence: His laconic reply suggested that he was not interested in the conversation.

meaning: generosity in bestowing money or gifts upon others
sentence: The charity was grateful for the largesse of its donors.

meaning: (of a quality or state) existing but not yet developed or manifest; hidden or concealed
sentence: The disease was latent in his system for years before it showed symptoms.

meaning: (of an action, idea, or goal) deserving praise and commendation
sentence: Her efforts to improve education were laudable.

meaning: to give a lot of public attention and approval to (someone); treat as a celebrity
sentence: The media tends to lionize successful athletes.

meaning: tending to talk a great deal; talkative
sentence: The loquacious hostess made sure every guest felt welcome.

meaning: expressed clearly; easy to understand
sentence: Her lucid explanation of the complex topic impressed the audience.

meaning: very vivid in color, especially so as to create an unpleasantly harsh or unnatural effect
sentence: The lurid details of the crime were splashed across the front page.

meaning: clear or obvious to the eye or mind
sentence: His disappointment was manifest in his expression.

meaning: many and various
sentence: The benefits of the new policy are manifold.

meaning: to treat (a person, group, or concept) as insignificant or peripheral
sentence: The new policies marginalize the needs of the poor.

meaning: self-pityingly or tearfully sentimental, often through drunkenness
sentence: The movie was criticized for its maudlin sentimentality.

meaning: an unorthodox or independent-minded person
sentence: He was considered a maverick in the field of science.

meaning: a feeling of pensive sadness, typically with no obvious cause
sentence: The rainy weather added to her sense of melancholy.

meaning: untruthfulness
sentence: The politician's mendacity was exposed by the investigative journalist.

meaning: (of a person) subject to sudden or unpredictable changes of mood or mind
sentence: His mercurial temperament made him difficult to work with.

meaning: showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise
sentence: She was meticulous in her preparation for the presentation.

meaning: having or showing a dislike of other people; unsociable
sentence: The misanthropic writer lived alone in a cabin in the woods.

meaning: conforming to or following what is currently popular and fashionable
sentence: The restaurant's decor was modish and trendy.

meaning: lasting for a very short time
sentence: She felt a momentary pang of guilt after the argument.

meaning: dull, tedious, and repetitious; lacking in variety and interest
sentence: The monotonous routine of her job made her long for a change.

meaning: sullen and ill-tempered
sentence: He became morose after the breakup and didn't talk to anyone for days.

meaning: lacking interest or excitement; dull
sentence: She longed for adventure and excitement beyond her mundane existence.

meaning: more generous than is usual or necessary
sentence: The millionaire was known for his munificent donations to charity.

meaning: (especially of a process or organization) just coming into existence and beginning to display signs of future potential
sentence: The nascent technology promises to revolutionize the industry.

meaning: (typically of an action or activity) wicked or criminal
sentence: The police uncovered the gang's nefarious activities.

meaning: failing to take proper care in doing something
sentence: The company was found negligent in its handling of the hazardous materials.

meaning: harmful, poisonous, or very unpleasant
sentence: The noxious fumes from the factory made nearby residents sick.

meaning: stubbornly refusing to change one's opinion or course of action
sentence: Despite the evidence, he remained obdurate in his denial of the facts.

meaning: to render obscure, unclear, or unintelligible
sentence: The lawyer's complex arguments only served to obfuscate the issue.

meaning: not aware of or not concerned about what is happening around one
sentence: She was oblivious to the chaos happening around her.

meaning: not discovered or known about; uncertain
sentence: The origins of the ritual are obscure.

meaning: obedient or attentive to an excessive or servile degree
sentence: The waiter's obsequious manner made the guests uncomfortable.

meaning: stubbornly refusing to change one's opinion or chosen course of action, despite attempts to persuade one to do so
sentence: The obstinate child refused to eat his vegetables.

meaning: not able to be seen through; not transparent
sentence: The opaque glass blocked the view from outside.

meaning: harsh criticism or censure
sentence: The politician faced opprobrium for his controversial remarks.

meaning: stated or appearing to be true, but not necessarily so
sentence: His ostensible reason for visiting was to check on the project, but he really wanted to see his old friend.

meaning: characterized by vulgar or pretentious display; designed to impress or attract notice
sentence: The ostentatious mansion was filled with expensive artwork and gold fixtures.

meaning: to move faster than and overtake (someone else)
sentence: The new model outstrips its competitors in both speed and efficiency.

meaning: in a state of nervous excitement or anxiety
sentence: She was too overwrought to speak after the accident.

meaning: (of food or drink) pleasant to taste
sentence: The chef prepared a palatable meal that everyone enjoyed.

meaning: to make (a disease or its symptoms) less severe or unpleasant without removing the cause
sentence: The medication can only palliate the symptoms, not cure the disease.

meaning: able to be touched or felt
sentence: There was a palpable tension in the room during the meeting.

meaning: strange or odd; unusual
sentence: There was something peculiar about the way he was acting.

meaning: the method and practice of teaching, especially as an academic subject or theoretical concept
sentence: She studied pedagogy to become a more effective teacher.

meaning: a person who is excessively concerned with minor details and rules or with displaying academic learning
sentence: His tendency to be a pedant made him unpopular among his colleagues.

meaning: lacking inspiration or excitement; dull
sentence: The movie was criticized for its pedestrian plot.

meaning: expressing contempt or disapproval
sentence: He used the word in a pejorative sense, implying that it was inferior.

meaning: translucently clear
sentence: The pellucid waters of the lake were perfect for swimming.

meaning: a strong or habitual liking for something or tendency to do something
sentence: She has a penchant for collecting rare books.

meaning: extremely poor; poverty-stricken
sentence: The penurious family struggled to make ends meet.

meaning: having or showing sensitive insight
sentence: His perceptive comments during the meeting impressed the boss.

meaning: lasting or existing for a long or apparently infinite time; enduring or continually recurring
sentence: Poverty is a perennial problem in the region.

meaning: deceitfulness; untrustworthiness
sentence: His perfidy was discovered when the stolen documents were found in his possession.

meaning: (of an action or gesture) carried out with a minimum of effort or reflection
sentence: His perfunctory nod indicated that he wasn't really paying attention.

meaning: to spread throughout (something); pervade
sentence: The smell of fresh coffee permeated the air.

meaning: having a harmful effect, especially in a gradual or subtle way
sentence: The pernicious effects of pollution on the environment are well documented.

meaning: relevant or applicable to a particular matter; apposite
sentence: She asked several pertinent questions during the presentation.

meaning: (especially of an unwelcome influence or physical effect) spreading widely throughout an area or a group of people
sentence: The pervasive smell of smoke made it difficult to breathe.

meaning: tending to see the worst aspect of things or believe that the worst will happen
sentence: He was pessimistic about the chances of success.

meaning: (of a person or their manner) childishly sulky or bad-tempered
sentence: The petulant child refused to apologize for his behavior.

meaning: (of a person) having an unemotional and stolidly calm disposition
sentence: Her phlegmatic demeanor helped her stay calm during the crisis.

meaning: devoutly religious
sentence: She was known for her pious devotion to her faith.

meaning: (of language or style) concise and forcefully expressive
sentence: His pithy remarks cut straight to the heart of the issue.

meaning: a strong verbal or written attack on someone or something
sentence: His polemic against the government's policies was widely read.

meaning: relating to or involving strongly critical, controversial, or disputatious writing or speech
sentence: The polemical article sparked a heated debate.

meaning: slow and clumsy because of great weight
sentence: The ponderous elephant moved slowly through the jungle.

meaning: to be a sign or warning that (something, especially something momentous or calamitous) is likely to happen
sentence: The dark clouds portend a storm.

meaning: all future generations of people
sentence: The monument was built to honor the heroes for posterity.

meaning: dealing with things sensibly and realistically in a way that is based on practical rather than theoretical considerations
sentence: She took a pragmatic approach to solving the problem.

meaning: to cause (an event or situation, typically one that is bad or undesirable) to happen suddenly, unexpectedly, or prematurely
sentence: The announcement precipitated a financial crisis.

meaning: (of a child) having developed certain abilities or proclivities at an earlier age than usual
sentence: The precocious child was reading chapter books by the age of five.

meaning: a difficult, unpleasant, or embarrassing situation
sentence: He found himself in a predicament after losing his wallet.

meaning: surpassing all others; very distinguished in some way
sentence: She is preeminent in her field of research.

meaning: spending money or resources freely and recklessly; wastefully extravagant
sentence: The prodigal son squandered his inheritance.

meaning: remarkably or impressively great in extent, size, or degree
sentence: The scientist's prodigious intellect was widely admired.

meaning: recklessly extravagant or wasteful in the use of resources
sentence: The company's profligate spending led to its downfall.

meaning: (of a state, quality, or emotion) very great or intense
sentence: His speech had a profound impact on the audience.

meaning: (especially of something offered or discharged) exuberantly plentiful; abundant
sentence: She offered her profuse apologies for the mistake.

meaning: present in large numbers or quantities; plentiful
sentence: The prolific author published several books each year.

meaning: (of speech or writing) using or containing too many words; tediously lengthy
sentence: His prolix style of writing made the book difficult to read.

meaning: important; famous
sentence: The actor was a prominent figure in the film industry.

meaning: to spread and promote (an idea, theory, etc.) widely
sentence: The organization works to propagate environmental awareness.

meaning: an inclination or natural tendency to behave in a particular way
sentence: She has a propensity for organizing things.

meaning: accurately describing or predicting what will happen in the future
sentence: The prophetic words of the leader were remembered for years.

meaning: a person who advocates a theory, proposal, or project
sentence: He is a strong proponent of renewable energy.

meaning: the state or quality of conforming to conventionally accepted standards of behavior or morals
sentence: They questioned the propriety of his actions.

meaning: having the style or diction of prose; lacking poetic beauty
sentence: His prosaic writing style was clear but lacked elegance.

meaning: to convert or attempt to convert (someone) from one religion, belief, or opinion to another
sentence: The missionaries traveled to remote areas to proselytize.

meaning: to prolong
sentence: The negotiations were protracted over several weeks.

meaning: occurring at a favorable time; opportune
sentence: The providential arrival of the ambulance saved his life.

meaning: skill or expertise in a particular activity or field
sentence: The athlete's prowess on the field earned him many awards.

meaning: acting with or showing care and thought for the future
sentence: She made a prudent decision to save for retirement.

meaning: childishly silly and trivial
sentence: His puerile behavior annoyed the adults at the party.

meaning: showing great attention to detail or correct behavior
sentence: She was punctilious about following the rules.

meaning: having a sharply strong taste or smell
sentence: The pungent smell of garlic filled the kitchen.

meaning: strongly laxative in effect
sentence: The doctor prescribed a purgative to cleanse the patient's system.

meaning: to appear or claim to be or do something, especially falsely; profess
sentence: The document purports to be an official statement, but it's actually a forgery.

meaning: showing a lack of courage or determination; timid
sentence: The pusillanimous leader avoided making tough decisions.

meaning: a state of perplexity or uncertainty over what to do in a difficult situation
sentence: He was in a quandary about whether to accept the job offer.

meaning: to reject or void, especially by legal procedure
sentence: The court quashed the verdict due to lack of evidence.

meaning: to put an end to (a rebellion or other disorder), typically by the use of force
sentence: The police were called in to quell the riot.

meaning: complaining in a petulant or whining manner
sentence: The querulous customer was not satisfied with any explanation.

meaning: in a state or period of inactivity or dormancy
sentence: The volcano has been quiescent for years.

meaning: representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class
sentence: He is the quintessential gentleman, always polite and considerate.

meaning: characterized by peculiar or unexpected traits
sentence: Her quirky sense of humor made her a popular guest at parties.

meaning: exceedingly idealistic; unrealistic and impractical
sentence: His quixotic quest for the perfect job led him to turn down several good offers.

meaning: of or occurring every day; daily
sentence: His quotidian routine included a morning jog and a cup of coffee.

meaning: relating to or affecting the fundamental nature of something; far-reaching or thorough
sentence: The company made radical changes to its structure.

meaning: a consequence of an action or event, especially when complex or unwelcome
sentence: The ramifications of the decision were not immediately clear.

meaning: (of a subject or knowledge) little known; abstruse
sentence: The professor's lectures were filled with recondite references.

meaning: breaking out again; renewing
sentence: There has been a recrudescent interest in the artist's work.

meaning: to remove impurities or unwanted elements from (a substance), typically as part of an industrial process
sentence: The company refines crude oil into gasoline.

meaning: to make changes in (something, typically a social, political, or economic institution or practice) in order to improve it
sentence: The government is planning to reform the tax system.

meaning: stubborn or unmanageable
sentence: The refractory child refused to follow the teacher's instructions.

meaning: shining brightly
sentence: The refulgent sun set behind the mountains.

meaning: to prove (a statement or theory) to be wrong or false; disprove
sentence: He refuted the allegations with solid evidence.

meaning: to make (someone or something) look or feel younger, fresher, or more lively
sentence: The spa treatment rejuvenated her tired skin.

meaning: to consign or dismiss to an inferior rank or position
sentence: The team was relegated to the lower division after losing the match.

meaning: to voluntarily cease to keep or claim; give up
sentence: He decided to relinquish his role as manager.

meaning: giving or intended as a remedy or cure
sentence: The school offers remedial classes for students who need extra help.

meaning: to make a forcefully reproachful protest
sentence: The workers remonstrated against the unfair treatment.

meaning: to go back on a promise, undertaking, or contract
sentence: He reneged on his promise to pay for the dinner.

meaning: filled or well-supplied with something
sentence: The book is replete with interesting facts and anecdotes.

meaning: deserving censure or condemnation
sentence: His reprehensible behavior shocked everyone at the meeting.

meaning: to subdue (someone or something) by force
sentence: The government sought to repress the uprising.

meaning: to address (someone) in such a way as to express disapproval or disappointment
sentence: He was reproached by his parents for coming home late.

meaning: to refuse to accept or be associated with
sentence: She repudiated the accusations against her.

meaning: extremely distasteful; unacceptable
sentence: His repugnant behavior offended everyone at the party.

meaning: to revoke, cancel, or repeal (a law, order, or agreement)
sentence: The government decided to rescind the controversial law.

meaning: (of a person or animal) able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions
sentence: The resilient community rebuilt their homes after the hurricane.

meaning: admirably purposeful, determined, and unwavering
sentence: She remained resolute in her decision to pursue a career in medicine.

meaning: (of sound) deep, clear, and continuing to sound or ring
sentence: The resonant tones of the bell could be heard throughout the village.

meaning: characterized by reserve or moderation; unemotional or dispassionate
sentence: His restrained response to the criticism showed his maturity.

meaning: increasing or reviving after a period of little activity, popularity, or occurrence
sentence: The resurgent interest in vintage clothing has boosted sales for thrift stores.

meaning: to draw or be drawn back or back in
sentence: The cat retracted its claws after it calmed down.

meaning: a surprising and previously unknown fact, especially one that is made known in a dramatic way
sentence: The revelation of his true identity shocked everyone.

meaning: to feel deep respect or admiration for (something)
sentence: The students revered their professor for his wisdom and kindness.

meaning: to return to (a previous state, condition, practice, etc.)
sentence: After the experiment failed, they reverted to their original plan.

meaning: referring to sexual matters in an amusingly rude or irreverent way
sentence: The comedian's ribald jokes were not suitable for all audiences.

meaning: the subjection of someone or something to contemptuous and dismissive language or behavior
sentence: He became the subject of ridicule after his embarrassing mistake.

meaning: to fail to resist (pressure, temptation, or some other negative force)
sentence: She succumbed to the temptation of eating the entire cake.

meaning: to gradually spread through or over
sentence: The room was suffused with the warm glow of the sunset.

meaning: behaving or looking as though one thinks one is superior to others
sentence: His supercilious attitude made him unpopular among his peers.

meaning: unnecessary, especially through being more than enough
sentence: The report was filled with superfluous details that distracted from the main points.

meaning: to supersede and replace
sentence: The old traditions were supplanted by modern customs.

meaning: to ask or beg for something earnestly or humbly
sentence: The villagers supplicated the king for mercy.

meaning: an excessive amount of something
sentence: There was a surfeit of food at the banquet.

meaning: to suppose that something is true without having evidence to confirm it
sentence: She surmised that he had left the party early.

meaning: kept secret, especially because it would not be approved of
sentence: They had a surreptitious meeting to discuss the confidential matters.

meaning: a person who acts obsequiously toward someone important in order to gain advantage
sentence: The boss was surrounded by sycophants who flattered him constantly.

meaning: of or forming a general summary or synopsis
sentence: The book provided a synoptic overview of the subject.

meaning: excessive confidence or boldness; audacity
sentence: He had the temerity to question the professor's findings.

meaning: a person's state of mind seen in terms of their being angry or calm
sentence: He struggled to control his temper during the argument.

meaning: relating to worldly as opposed to spiritual affairs; secular
sentence: The bishop focused on temporal matters as well as spiritual ones.

meaning: able to be maintained or defended against attack or objection
sentence: His argument was no longer tenable after new evidence was presented.

meaning: expressing or intending to promote a particular cause or point of view, especially a controversial one
sentence: The tendentious article sparked a heated debate.

meaning: very weak or slight
sentence: The connection between the two ideas was tenuous at best.

meaning: (especially of a liquid) only slightly warm; lukewarm
sentence: The tea was tepid by the time she drank it.

meaning: sparing in the use of words; abrupt
sentence: His terse reply indicated that he was not interested in further discussion.

meaning: showing or suffering from nervousness, fear, or a lack of confidence
sentence: The timorous student hesitated before speaking up in class.

meaning: a long, angry speech of criticism or accusation
sentence: The manager's tirade left the employees feeling demoralized.

meaning: full of twists and turns
sentence: The tortuous road wound through the mountains.

meaning: (of a person or animal) easy to control or influence
sentence: The dog was surprisingly tractable, following all of the trainer's commands.

meaning: not permanent
sentence: The transitory nature of fame means that today's celebrities can be forgotten tomorrow.

meaning: a feeling of fear or agitation about something that may happen
sentence: She felt a sense of trepidation before the big presentation.

meaning: unimportant or trivial
sentence: The meeting was bogged down by trifling details.

meaning: (of a remark, opinion, or idea) overused and consequently of little import; lacking originality or freshness
sentence: The speech was filled with trite expressions and clichs.

meaning: of little value or importance
sentence: She was annoyed by the trivial complaints from her coworkers.

meaning: to shorten (something) by cutting off the top or the end
sentence: The essay was truncated to fit the word limit.

meaning: making a loud, confused noise; uproarious
sentence: The tumultuous crowd was hard to control.

meaning: characterized by conflict, disorder, or confusion; not controlled or calm
sentence: The turbulent waters made it difficult for the boat to navigate.

meaning: present, appearing, or found everywhere
sentence: Smartphones have become ubiquitous in today's society.

meaning: offense or annoyance
sentence: She took umbrage at his rude remarks.

meaning: unable to be attacked, questioned, or defeated
sentence: The fortress was considered unassailable.

meaning: not right or reasonable
sentence: The company's unconscionable practices were exposed by the media.

meaning: to erode the base or foundation of (a rock formation)
sentence: His actions were intended to undermine her authority.

meaning: to underline (something)
sentence: The report underscores the need for better safety measures.

meaning: to move or go with a smooth up-and-down motion
sentence: The flag undulated in the breeze.

meaning: leaving no doubt; unambiguous
sentence: His answer was unequivocal: he would not support the proposal.

meaning: genuine; sincere
sentence: Her unfeigned interest in their stories made her a great listener.

meaning: released from restraint or inhibition
sentence: The artist's creativity was unfettered by convention.

meaning: never done or known before
sentence: The unprecedented move shocked the industry.

meaning: (of behavior or actions) not proper or appropriate
sentence: His unseemly conduct at the event was widely criticized.

meaning: (especially of a position or view) not able to be maintained or defended against attack or objection
sentence: The theory was proven untenable by new evidence.

meaning: unexpected and inappropriate or inconvenient
sentence: The meeting was interrupted by an untoward incident.

meaning: difficult to carry or move because of its size, shape, or weight
sentence: The unwieldy package was hard to carry through the narrow door.

meaning: to find fault with (someone); scold
sentence: The teacher upbraided the student for being late.

meaning: (of a person, especially a man) suave, courteous, and refined in manner
sentence: The urbane host made everyone feel welcome at the party.

meaning: designed to be useful or practical rather than attractive
sentence: The building's utilitarian design was functional but not aesthetically pleasing.

meaning: exhibiting different colors, especially as irregular patches or streaks
sentence: The garden was filled with variegated plants, creating a vibrant display.

meaning: to boast about or praise (something), especially excessively
sentence: He vaunted his achievements at every opportunity.

meaning: showing strong feeling; forceful, passionate, or intense
sentence: She was vehement in her opposition to the new policy.

meaning: showing or motivated by susceptibility to bribery
sentence: The venal official accepted bribes in exchange for favors.

meaning: to regard with great respect; revere
sentence: The community venerates the local hero for his bravery.

meaning: speaking or representing the truth
sentence: The journalist was known for his veracious reporting.

meaning: using or expressed in more words than are needed
sentence: The verbose speech was hard to follow.

meaning: used as an intensifier, often to qualify a metaphor
sentence: The party was a veritable feast, with food and drink in abundance.

meaning: the state of being annoyed, frustrated, or worried
sentence: Her repeated lateness caused him great vexation.

meaning: keeping careful watch for possible danger or difficulties
sentence: The guards remained vigilant throughout the night.

meaning: to speak or write about in an abusively disparaging manner
sentence: The politician was vilified in the press for his controversial remarks.

meaning: to clear (someone) of blame or suspicion
sentence: The new evidence served to vindicate her claim of innocence.

meaning: (of a disease or poison) extremely severe or harmful in its effects
sentence: The virulent strain of the virus caused widespread panic.

meaning: having a thick, sticky consistency between solid and liquid; having a high viscosity
sentence: The viscous syrup poured slowly over the pancakes.

meaning: (especially of a person) thinking about or planning the future with imagination or wisdom
sentence: The entrepreneur was a visionary leader who transformed the industry.

meaning: (of a substance) easily evaporated at normal temperatures
sentence: The volatile chemicals must be handled with care.

meaning: (of a person) talking fluently, readily, or incessantly
sentence: The voluble speaker captivated the audience with his eloquence.

meaning: wanting or devouring great quantities of food
sentence: The voracious appetite of the athlete was well known.

meaning: susceptible to physical or emotional attack or harm
sentence: The small village was vulnerable to attack by the enemy.

meaning: (especially of a condition or feeling) decrease in vigor, power, or extent; become weaker
sentence: His influence in the company is waning as new leadership takes over.

meaning: feeling or showing caution about possible dangers or problems
sentence: She was wary of strangers offering help.

meaning: characterized by, expressive of, or causing sorrow or misery
sentence: The woeful tale of lost love brought tears to everyone's eyes.

meaning: having or showing zeal
sentence: The zealous campaigners worked tirelessly for their cause.

meaning: the time at which something is most powerful or successful
sentence: The singer reached the zenith of her career in the early 2000s.

meaning: a soft gentle breeze
sentence: The zephyr from the sea brought a coolness to the evening.

meaning: great enthusiasm and energy
sentence: He had a zest for life that was infectious.

meaning: to have an intense feeling of longing for something, typically something that one has lost or been separated from
sentence: She yearned for the days when life was simpler.

meaning: to join together; to connect, especially in terms of bondage or servitude
sentence: The farmers yoked the oxen to the plow.

meaning: to produce or provide (a natural, agricultural, or industrial product)
sentence: The fields yielded a bountiful harvest.

meaning: having or showing a feeling of vague or regretful longing
sentence: She looked at the old photos with a wistful smile.

meaning: playfully quaint or fanciful, especially in an appealing and amusing way

meaning: feeling or showing caution about possible dangers or problems

meaning: to decrease in vigor, power, or extent; become weaker
sentence: His influence in the company was waning as new leadership took over.

meaning: susceptible to physical or emotional harm
sentence: The small village was vulnerable to attacks.

meaning: occupying or containing much space; large in volume, in particular
sentence: She wore a voluminous skirt that swirled as she danced.

meaning: to make (someone) feel annoyed, frustrated, or worried, especially with trivial matters
sentence: The constant buzzing of the fly vexed him to no end.

meaning: accorded a great deal of respect, especially because of age, wisdom, or character
sentence: The venerable professor had taught at the university for over 40 years.

meaning: to alternate or waver between different opinions or actions; be indecisive
sentence: She vacillated for so long that the opportunity was lost.

meaning: present, appearing, or found everywhere
sentence: Smartphones have become ubiquitous in todays society.

meaning: to shorten by cutting off the top or the end
sentence: The essay was truncated to meet the word limit.

meaning: of little value or importance
sentence: The argument was over something trivial, but it still upset her.

meaning: to change in form, nature, or substance
sentence: Alchemy was believed to be able to transmute base metals into gold.

meaning: perceptible by touch
sentence: There was a tangible sense of relief in the room after the announcement.

meaning: very weak or slight
sentence: The connection between the two ideas was tenuous at best.

meaning: (of a person) reserved or uncommunicative in speech; saying little
sentence: The taciturn man rarely spoke, preferring to listen.

meaning: the interaction or cooperation of two or more organizations, substances, or other agents to produce a combined effect greater than the sum of their separate effects
sentence: The synergy between the two departments led to better overall performance.

meaning: of such excellence, grandeur, or beauty as to inspire great admiration or awe
sentence: The view from the mountaintop was absolutely sublime.

meaning: not being what it purports to be; false or fake
sentence: The spurious claims of the advertisement were quickly debunked.

meaning: comfort or consolation in a time of distress or sadness
sentence: She found solace in her friends after the loss of her pet.

meaning: calm, peaceful, and untroubled; tranquil
sentence: The serene lake reflected the sky like a mirror.

meaning: to examine or inspect closely and thoroughly
sentence: The detective scrutinized every detail of the crime scene.

meaning: optimistic or positive, especially in an apparently bad or difficult situation
sentence: Despite the challenges, she remained sanguine about the future.

meaning: a short period of rest or relief from something difficult or unpleasant
sentence: The weekend offered a brief respite from her busy work schedule.

meaning: (of a person or animal) able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions
sentence: Children are often more resilient than adults realize.

meaning: to address (someone) in such a way as to express disapproval or disappointment
sentence: He was reproached by his parents for coming home late.

meaning: the practice of exchanging things with others for mutual benefit
sentence: Reciprocity is key to maintaining healthy relationships.

meaning: a state of perplexity or uncertainty over what to do in a difficult situation
sentence: He was in a quandary over which option to choose.

meaning: attractively unusual or old-fashioned
sentence: The quaint village looked like something out of a fairy tale.

meaning: a person, especially a young one, endowed with exceptional qualities or abilities
sentence: The child prodigy could play the piano beautifully by age five.

meaning: a large or excessive amount of something
sentence: There was a plethora of options to choose from at the restaurant.

meaning: to make (someone) less angry or hostile
sentence: She tried to placate the angry customer by offering a discount.

meaning: a strong or habitual liking for something or tendency to do something
sentence: He has a penchant for collecting rare coins.

meaning: not discovered or known about; uncertain
sentence: The origins of the ancient artifact are obscure.

meaning: quick and light in movement or action; agile
sentence: The dancer's nimble movements captivated the audience.

meaning: a feeling of pensive sadness, typically with no obvious cause
sentence: There was a melancholy air about him after the breakup.

meaning: a passionate expression of grief or sorrow
sentence: The poem was a lament for the lost soldiers.

meaning: to light or set on fire; to arouse or inspire (an emotion or feeling)
sentence: The teachers enthusiasm kindled a love of learning in her students.

meaning: having or showing eagerness or enthusiasm
sentence: She was keen to start her new job after graduating.

meaning: feeling or expressing great happiness and triumph
sentence: The team was jubilant after winning the championship.

meaning: to overwhelm (someone) with things or people to be dealt with
sentence: She was inundated with emails after the product launch.

meaning: inborn; natural
sentence: She had an innate ability to make everyone around her feel comfortable.

meaning: feeling or showing anger or annoyance at what is perceived as unfair treatment
sentence: He was indignant when he was unfairly accused of cheating.

meaning: making marks that cannot be removed
sentence: The experience left an indelible impression on her.

meaning: not showing proper respect; rude
sentence: The impertinent student was sent to the principal's office for talking back.

meaning: in accordance with the highest standards; faultless
sentence: Her work ethic was impeccable, earning her the respect of her peers.

meaning: a chaotic din caused by a crowd of people
sentence: The hubbub of the city could be heard from their apartment.

meaning: feeling strained as a result of having demands persistently made on one; harassed
sentence: The harried mother of three barely had time to relax.

meaning: a loud and boisterous laugh
sentence: The comedian's joke caused the audience to burst into guffaws.

meaning: shrewd or spirited initiative and resourcefulness
sentence: It took a lot of gumption to start his own business at such a young age.

meaning: to shock or excite (someone) into taking action
sentence: The tragic event galvanized the community to take action.

meaning: courage in pain or adversity
sentence: She showed great fortitude in the face of adversity.
